summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Jeffrey Epstein with one count of sex trafficking conspiracy and one count of sex trafficking. It alleges that from at least 2002 to 2005, Epstein sexually exploited dozens of minor girls at his residences in Manhattan and Palm Beach, creating a network where victims were paid and recruited to bring other minors. The indictment details the methods of abuse and identifies several unnamed employees and victims who facilitated the scheme.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary defendant charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. The indictment alleges he sexually exploited dozens of minor girls at his homes in New York and Florida, paying them and using victim-recruiters to expand his network.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and filed the indictment.

connections.description: Employee-1, based in New York, communicated with victims via phone to arrange sexual encounters for Epstein at the New York Residence.
Employee-2, an assistant, contacted minor victims in Florida to schedule sexual encounters for Epstein at the Palm Beach Residence, sometimes while both were in New York.
Employee-3, an assistant, contacted individuals victimized at the Palm Beach Residence to schedule sexual encounters for Epstein.
Minor Victim-1 was recruited in 2002, repeatedly sexually abused by Epstein at the New York Residence over years, paid for each encounter, and encouraged to recruit other girls, which she did.
Minor Victim-2 was recruited in 2004, repeatedly sexually abused by Epstein at the Palm Beach Residence over years, paid for each encounter, and encouraged to recruit other girls, which she did.

Minor Victim-3 was recruited in 2005, repeatedly sexually abused by Epstein at the Palm Beach Residence over years, paid for each encounter, and encouraged to recruit other girls, which she did. Epstein asked and was told her age.

events.title: Sex Trafficking Conspiracy Period
events.description: The period during which Jeffrey Epstein allegedly conspired to sexually exploit and abuse dozens of minor girls at his residences in New York and Florida, creating a network of victims.

events.title: Recruitment and Abuse of Minor Victim-1 Begins
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was recruited to engage in sex acts with Epstein and began being repeatedly sexually abused at the New York Residence.

events.title: Employee-1 Schedules Appointment for Minor Victim-1
events.description: Employee-1, on behalf of Epstein, placed a telephone call to Minor Victim-1 to schedule an appointment for her to engage in paid sex acts with Epstein.

events.title: Recruitment and Abuse of Minor Victim-2 Begins
events.description: Minor Victim-2 was recruited to engage in sex acts with Epstein and began being repeatedly sexually abused at the Palm Beach Residence.

events.title: Employee-2 Schedules Appointments for Minor Victims
events.description: Employee-2, on behalf of Epstein, placed telephone calls to Minor Victim-2 and Minor Victim-3 in Florida to schedule appointments for them to engage in paid sex acts with Epstein.

events.title: Recruitment and Abuse of Minor Victim-3 Begins
events.description: Minor Victim-3 was recruited to engage in sex acts with Epstein and began being repeatedly sexually abused at the Palm Beach Residence. Epstein asked and was told her age.

events.title: Employee-3 Schedules Appointment for Minor Victim-3
events.description: Employee-3 placed a telephone call to Minor Victim-3 to schedule an appointment for her to engage in paid sex acts with Epstein.

locations: Manhattan, New York (specifically the Upper East Side, 'New York Residence')
9 East 71st Street, New York, New York (property owned by Maple, Inc., listed for forfeiture)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the court)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors, specifically for exploiting dozens of minor girls from at least 2002 to 2005.
The indictment describes a systematic scheme where victims, some as young as 14, were recruited for 'massages' that escalated into sexual acts, for which they were paid hundreds of dollars in cash.
Epstein allegedly used victim-recruiters, paying them to bring other minor girls to him, thereby creating and maintaining a vast network of underage victims in both New York and Florida.
Several unnamed employees (Employee-1, Employee-2, Employee-3) are identified as facilitating the scheme by contacting victims and scheduling sexual encounters for Epstein.
The indictment includes a forfeiture allegation seeking Epstein's property at 9 East 71st Street in New York, owned by Maple, Inc., as property used to facilitate the offenses.
